title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children node listing is displayed. The data set was created without an SQL statement. The new data source does not have any database, table, or column information. The issue can be reproduced by creating a new data set without an SQL statement and changing the data source. The actual result is that no children node listing is shown. If the data set editor is closed and reopened, the issue persists.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without specifying an SQL statement.
2. Change the data source for the data set.
3. Check if the children node listing is displayed correctly in the data set editor page of the query tab.
